page.content:
AMBERLEY AND BURY
These twin villages are the centre of habitation and interest with the hamlet of Houghton lying in between. They lie on either side of the River Arun, winding its tidal way through the gap in the South Downs. The villages were once joined until 1964, by a ferry over the river. Now a three mile journey by road over Houghton Bridge is involved. Medieval churches face each other over the river, presiding over a still agricultural scene even through mechanisation requires fewer workers. Thus old farm cottages are now combined and renovated to house retired people. Each village is in a different church deanery, local government area,education area etc..There is little social inter-relationship.
